subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Wednesday, 13 June, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Man City close in on new manager
Man City hope to appoint a new boss within a week, with Juande Ramos and Co Adriaanse topping their wanted list.



 
Smith admits he may quit Man Utd
Man Utd striker Alan Smith warns he may leave if he fails to receive assurances from boss Sir Alex Ferguson.



 
Saha will be fit for season start
The agents of Man Utd striker Louis Saha's dismiss suggestions he will miss the first few months of the season.








GOLF




New caddie helps Monty at Oakmont
Colin Montgomerie hires local caddie Billy Goddard for the US open at Oakmont, which starts this week.



 
Davies untroubled by major stage
Welsh amateur Rhys Davies says he is unfazed by the atmosphere at the US Open, his first major championship.



 
Woods relishing Oakmont challenge
Tiger Woods expects the US Open at Oakmont to be "one of the most difficult tests" he will ever face.








MOTORSPORT




McLaren look to cool Hamilton row
McLaren boss Ron Dennis denies claims the team is giving preference to rookie Lewis Hamilton over Fernando Alonso.



 
McNish pumped up for Le Mans test
Audi's Allan McNish says he is confident they can keep up their winning streak at the Le Mans 24 Hours in the face of opposition from Peugeot.



 
Kubica 'feels ready for US race'
BMW Sauber's team boss says Robert Kubica wants to race in Sunday's US Grand Prix after his 180mph crash in Canada.








FORMULA ONE




McLaren look to cool Hamilton row
McLaren boss Ron Dennis denies claims the team is giving preference to rookie Lewis Hamilton over Fernando Alonso.



 
Walker tips Hamilton for F1 title
Former commentator Murray Walker believes Briton Lewis Hamilton can win the Formula One World Championship.



 
Unscathed Kubica out of hospital
BMW Sauber driver Robert Kubica leaves hospital in Montreal after his horrific crash at the Canadian Grand Prix.








ATHLETICS




Williams desperate for comeback
Welsh 400m hurdler Rhys Williams admits to frustration as injury keeps him out of the European Cup squad.



 
Pickering gets European Cup nod
Craig Pickering beats Mark Lewis-Francis to the 100m berth in Great Britain's team for the European Cup on 23-24 June.



 
Gillick sets new Irish 400m mark
David Gillick smashes the Irish 400m record at Switzerland's Atletica Geneve meeting.








CYCLING




Moreau replaces Wiggins as leader
Christophe Moreau wins stage two of the Dauphine Libere to replace Britain's Bradley Wiggins as overall leader.



 
Wiggins retains lead in Dauphine 
Britain's Bradley Wiggins retains a one-second overall lead after the first stage proper of the Dauphine Libere. 



 
Wiggins wins Dauphine time-trial
Britain's Bradley Wiggins gives his Tour de France prospects a boost by winning the prologue in the Dauphine Libere.

Ten to Tackle
Test your knowledge of the last seven days in sport



 
Quotes of the Week
Ramon Calderon on David Beckham, plus Lewis Hamilton and Graham Taylor



 
Comment: Formula fun with Lewis
Robbo on Lewis Hamilton and the England cricket team
